current_company.description: My current work focuses on the economic evaluation of power system inertia services. I devote this project to investigate the economic value of power system resource inertia and proposed methods to integrate inertia requirement into the existing market framework. In this topic, fast-responding storage resources are of huge interest to be studies as one alternative method providing inertia services.I also work on big data and its applications in power systems, conducted research on planning and real-time operation applications of Big Data analytics, e.g., data visualization for improving situational awareness.My research topics cover the issues related to electricity market and renewable integration into systems as well. I have done work on the probabilistic production simulation for systems with concentrated solar plants. I primarily constructed a versatile simulation tool to emulate the behavior of power systems with concentrated solar plants. In addition, I developed a capable real-time and day-ahead market simulation tool to investigate the potential benefits of coordinately dispatching concentrated solar plants and wind resources.

current_company.description: My research involves the identification and validation of novel descriptors of clonal heterogeneity in leukemia. I am scaling up single cell, highly multiplexed molecular biology assays along with computational approaches for quantifying genetic diversity within individual cancer samples. current_company.description: My research involves the identification and validation of novel descriptors of clonal heterogeneity in leukemia. I am scaling up single cell, highly multiplexed molecular biology assays along with computational approaches for quantifying genetic diversity within individual cancer samples. current_company.description: I work with businesses across multiple sectors to embed sustainability principles into both corporate roles (research, product development, human resources, strategy, and risk) and operational functions (supply chain, manufacturing, quality, logistics, dealerships and customer processes). Typical approaches include the following.Preventing waste and problems: Identify and address the root causes and total costs associated with various forms of waste. Implementing measures that correct these problems prevents waste generation and reduces the potential for a wide range of risks and accidents.Innovation diffusion and adoption: Assess innovation performance, advantages and complexity. Conduct demonstrations and pilot trials as necessary to prove performance capabilities and develop design parameters.Systems Optimization: Leverage innovation and technology to maximize efficiency and productivity. This may include product design, manufacturing, supply chain, accounting, logistics, maintenance, service and customer operations.Circular economy development: Develop systems for recovering and distributing products, components and materials. Assess, test, develop and implement processes for remanufacturing, rebuilding, refurbishing, and recycling to the highest possible use. Energy efficiency: Modernization and optimization of production processes such as compressed air, pumping systems, process heating, and waste heat recovery. Distributed power generation with combined heat and power capabilities. Alternative and Renewable Energy: Distributed power generation from diverse fuel sources such as waste gases such as flare gas and mine methane. Power generation from biogas produced from landfills and the anaerobic digestion of livestock wastes, food wastes and municipal wastewater treatment. Restoring degraded properties to states that are economically productive and ecologically stable.

And work it has. A direct mail piece for networking manufacturer McDATA netted an unheard of 43% response rate. Not bad when you consider that 3% in direct mail is considered quite good.Every project, no matter how big or small, deserves a big idea. And that holds just as true for a paper place mat atop a table in Village Inn as it does for a double-truck newspaper ad in the Denver Post.Pithiness leads to effectiveness. In today’s busy world where attention spans are measured by the nanosecond, if it isn’t simple, short and sweet, people won’t get it. They don’t have time to.

current_company.description: I work with businesses across multiple sectors to embed sustainability principles into both corporate roles (research, product development, human resources, strategy, and risk) and operational functions (supply chain, manufacturing, quality, logistics, dealerships and customer processes). Typical approaches include the following.Preventing waste and problems: Identify and address the root causes and total costs associated with various forms of waste. Implementing measures that correct these problems prevents waste generation and reduces the potential for a wide range of risks and accidents.Innovation diffusion and adoption: Assess innovation performance, advantages and complexity. Conduct demonstrations and pilot trials as necessary to prove performance capabilities and develop design parameters.Systems Optimization: Leverage innovation and technology to maximize efficiency and productivity. This may include product design, manufacturing, supply chain, accounting, logistics, maintenance, service and customer operations.Circular economy development: Develop systems for recovering and distributing products, components and materials. Assess, test, develop and implement processes for remanufacturing, rebuilding, refurbishing, and recycling to the highest possible use. Energy efficiency: Modernization and optimization of production processes such as compressed air, pumping systems, process heating, and waste heat recovery. Distributed power generation with combined heat and power capabilities. Alternative and Renewable Energy: Distributed power generation from diverse fuel sources such as waste gases such as flare gas and mine methane. Power generation from biogas produced from landfills and the anaerobic digestion of livestock wastes, food wastes and municipal wastewater treatment. Restoring degraded properties to states that are economically productive and ecologically stable.

current_company.description: Since 2010, Berger Investment Group ("BIG") has focused on acquiring opportunistic, under performing, and distressed multifamily assets throughout the Chicagoland area, primarily focusing on Chicago's south side neighborhoods. Berger Investment Group has completed over 60 transactions in a short period of time with deals ranging from REOs, short sales, distressed note purchases, and tax deeds. By having an opportunistic approach, multifamily deal size can range from 2 units to 60+ units, with values in excess of $5 million.Berger Investment Group currently owns and manages over 200 multifamily units located in South Shore, Woodlawn, Jackson Park and Hyde Park. Through a hands-on approach, Berger Investment Group focuses on all aspects of a value-add transaction from purchasing properties directly from banks and other institutions, to managing the construction process from start to finish to ensure quality and cost control in order to generate the highest annual returns. Berger Investment Group takes an opportunistic approach to every transaction by evaluating the current market conditions and determining a buy and hold versus flip strategy. Berger Investment Group prides itself on the level of quality and service. Investing in typically low-income neighborhoods, Berger Investment Group provides condominium quality finishes in its rental product. Additionally, Berger Property Management (a subsidiary), oversees day-to-day operations of all properties."THINK...BIG"
